design_audit.randomization_scheme: University of Cape Town policy randomly allocates roommates to rooms within residence halls. Treatment is having a roommate of a different race (mixracebas). Randomization occurs within residence (Res_base) x race strata.
design_audit.interaction_with_race: Race x Residence FE (blackRes, whiteRes) included in full-sample specs
design_audit.sample_restriction: round==2 (endline), balanced panel (uctdata_balanced.dta), subsample by race (white==1 or black==1)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Racial stereotypes as measured by Implicit Association Test (Race IAT D-score), where higher values indicate less prejudice against Black students
claim_object.treatment_concept: Randomly assigned to a mixed-race room at baseline (mixracebas=1 vs 0)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of inter-racial roommate exposure on racial stereotypes at endline, controlling for baseline IAT (ANCOVA)
claim_object.target_population: White students in UCT residences with random roommate assignment (primary); Black students (secondary)

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Col1-White-RaceIAT
baseline_specs.description: Effect of mixed-race room on White students' Race IAT at endline, with lagged outcome, own and roommate controls, residence FE

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Col2-Black-RaceIAT
baseline_specs.description: Effect of mixed-race room on Black students' Race IAT at endline, with lagged outcome, own and roommate controls, residence FE

constraints.notes: Minimum is 12: own controls only (11 from controls_subsample) + mandatory lagged outcome (L.DscoreraceIAT), as shown in Table A7 (no roommate controls robustness). Maximum is 22: own (11) + roommate (10) + lagged outcome (1), as in baseline Table 3. Lagged outcome is mandatory for ANCOVA structure and must not be dropped. Race dummies (white, coloured, Else) only used in full-sample specifications, not race subsamples.

canonical.notes: Paper clusters at the room level (roomnum_base) throughout, which is the randomization unit.

variants.notes: Cluster at residence level as a stress test (coarser clustering).

sampling.notes: LOO over own controls (6 variable groups with missingness indicators counted as pairs) and roommate controls (5 variable groups). Plus the revealed drop-all-roommate-controls variant. Full enumeration is feasible.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table 1 / Table 2 Panel A: Balance tests of baseline IAT, demographics on mixracebas, controlling for residence FE.
Table A1: Correlates of attrition by treatment status.

exploration_notes: explore/outcome/academic_iat: DscoreacaIAT outcome (Table 3 cols 3-4) changes outcome concept from Race IAT to Academic IAT -- moved from rc/form/academic_iat_outcome.
rc/sample/balanced_panel_only removed: the data file used (uctdata_balanced.dta) IS the balanced panel, so this is the default, not an RC variant.

design_audit.randomization_scheme: Same as G1: UCT policy randomly allocates roommates within residence halls.
design_audit.sample_restriction: round==2 (endline), balanced panel, subsample by race

claim_object.outcome_concept: Academic performance (GPA, exams passed, continuation/non-dropout, PCA performance index) at end of first year
claim_object.treatment_concept: Randomly assigned to a mixed-race room at baseline (mixracebas=1 vs 0)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of inter-racial roommate exposure on academic outcomes
claim_object.target_population: Black students in UCT residences (primary claim: Black students improve); White students and full sample (secondary)

baseline_specs.label: Table4-Black-GPA
baseline_specs.description: Effect of mixed-race room on Black students' GPA, with own + roommate controls, residence FE and program FE

baseline_specs.label: Table4-Black-ExamsPassed
baseline_specs.description: Effect of mixed-race room on Black students' exams passed

baseline_specs.label: Table4-Black-Continue
baseline_specs.description: Effect of mixed-race room on Black students' continuation (non-dropout)

constraints.notes: Minimum is own controls only (11 controls_subsample) from Table A9 (no roommate controls robustness). Maximum is own + roommate controls (21). No lagged outcome in academic specs. Program FE (regprogram) is mandatory for academic outcomes.

canonical.notes: Paper clusters at the room level throughout.

sampling.notes: Multiple outcome variables (GPA, examspassed, continue, PCAperf) generate specs multiplicatively with control variations. LOO + major revealed variants enumerable.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table 1: Balance tests by race subsample.

exploration_notes: explore/population/white: Table4-White-GPA moved from baseline_spec_ids -- changes target population from Black to White students.
explore/population/full_sample: Table4-Full-GPA moved from baseline_spec_ids -- changes target population from Black to all students.

explore/mechanism/same_faculty_interaction: rc/controls/add_interaction_mixsamefaculty (Table A11) moved from rc_spec_ids -- adds mixsamefaculty and samefaculty interaction, which changes the treatment concept (decomposing by faculty overlap).
rc/fe/add_program_fe removed: redundant since baseline already includes i.regprogram.
rc/sample/restrict_white_only removed: changes target population, belongs in explore/population/white.

design_audit.sample_restriction: round==2 (endline), balanced panel, subsample by race

claim_object.outcome_concept: Social outcomes: friendships with different-race peers (PCAfriend), racial attitudes (PCAattitude), communication across races (PCAcomm), pro-social behavior (PCAsocial)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Randomly assigned to a mixed-race room at baseline (mixracebas=1 vs 0)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of inter-racial roommate exposure on social/attitudinal outcomes
claim_object.target_population: White students (primary for friendships/attitudes); Black students and full sample (secondary)

baseline_specs.label: Table5-White-PCAfriend
baseline_specs.description: Effect of mixed-race room on White students' cross-racial friendships PCA index

baseline_specs.label: Table5-White-PCAattitude
baseline_specs.description: Effect of mixed-race room on White students' racial attitudes PCA index

constraints.notes: Same control structure as G1/G2. No lagged outcome control (unlike IAT specs). Table A15 shows robustness with no-missing versions of PCA indices.

canonical.notes: Paper clusters at the room level throughout.

sampling.notes: Multiple outcome variables (PCAfriend, PCAattitude, PCAcomm, PCAsocial) times control/sample variants. Enumerable.

exploration_notes: explore/population/black: Table5-Black-PCAfriend moved from baseline_spec_ids -- changes target population from White to Black students.
explore/population/full_sample: Table5-Full-PCAfriend moved from baseline_spec_ids -- changes target population from White to all students.
